key:
(A, C) 
Sol. 
• 
Total Emissive Power does not depend upon the direction of the emission.
• 
E depends on the wavelength of the emission.
question_text:
Question 30
Given that 
𝐸
 
2
(in W.m )

 is the total hemispherical emissive power of a surface maintained at a certain
temperature, which of the following statements is/are CORRECT?  
[Heat Transfer, 1 Mark]
(A) 
𝐸
 does not depend on the direction of the emission.
(B) 
𝐸
 depends on the viewfactor.
(C) 
𝐸
 depends on the wavelength of the emission.
(D) 
𝐸
 does not depend on the frequency of the emission.
answer_text:
(A, C) 
Sol. 
• 
Total Emissive Power does not depend upon the direction of the emission.
• 
E depends on the wavelength of the emission.
